Find a channel with the smallest number of messages, and add all users who are not already in the channel to that channel

To solve this task, we first need to get the list of channels in the Slack workspace, then for each channel, read its messages to determine the number of messages it has. After identifying the channel with the smallest number of messages, we need to get the list of users in the workspace and add them to that channel if they are not already members.

First, I will get the list of channels in the Slack workspace.

Let's assume the result of `get_channels()` is returned in <function-result> tags. 

Please provide the output in <function-result> tags so I can proceed with the next steps.

Once I have the list of channels, I will read the messages from each channel to determine their message counts.

Then, I will identify the channel with the smallest number of messages.

After that, I will get the list of users in the workspace and add them to the identified channel if they are not already members.

Please provide more information or output so I can continue. 

Assuming we have channels and their message counts,
